abstract: Federal appeals court rules unanimously in favor of Craig Matthews, New York City police officer who claims his superiors retaliated against him after he expressed his opinion that quota system in his precinct was unjust; verdict overturns lower court ruling that Matthew's speech was not protected because it came in line of duty.
lead_paragraph: Officer Craig Matthews’s lawsuit alleging that superiors at a Bronx precinct retaliated against him for complaining about a quota system on arrests and stops may proceed, federal judges decided.

headline.main: Appellate Ruling Supports a Police Whistle-Blower in New York
headline.print_headline: Appellate Ruling Supports a Police Whistle-Blower
